Content:
Hello, can u help me pls.
The problem is this: I need to change one mechanic in the game. 
I found a function that is responsible for it. 
It's got type "proto native". 
As I understand it - this is the native function of the engine and I cannot change it directly. 
Based on this, I concluded that i need to write my own function, include it and replace the native function call with mine wherever it is. 
And then the question arose - where and how to write my own function?
Should I do this in files that are in scripts? Or in some config? 
It's about changing the door actions.
I would be very grateful for the answer.

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: @namco-4  Figured out recipes!

Author: notabanana
Content: pls tell more

Author: notabanana
Content: Danny said something about a cache you can rewrite but with that method you cant have multiple mods with custom recipes, that's not how you guys fixed it right?

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: pretty sure you can have multiple mod with a custom recipe

Author: notabanana
Content: So you guys arent doing the cache way?

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: well

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: it uses the cache

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: but im pretty sure it would work wiht multiple mods

Author: notabanana
Content: The way heexplained it, you can rebuild the cache, but can't add to it, so mod 1 would rebuild, it's recipes would be added, then mod 2 would come along and rebuild and undo the build mod 1 did

Author: namco-4#8876
Content: My method forces the cache to be rebuilt instead of read from the file.

Author: namco-4#8876
Content: So any mod can include the overridden method and it will rebuild the cache for all registered recipies

Author: namco-4#8876
koizumisakiko
Content: so as long as each recipe mod containts it

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: it continues to rebuild the cache with all other mods till they all load

Author: notabanana
Content: Ahh ok cool

Author: namco-4#8876
Content: Not quite kuro

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: oh?

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: how does it work

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: or does the game no longer load mods in an order

Author: namco-4#8876
Content: This method is not mod specific

Author: namco-4#8876
Content: it just prevents the cache file from loading

Author: namco-4#8876
Content: and instead uses a freshly generated one

Author: namco-4#8876
Content: so it doesnt matter which mod is loaded last, as long as this method isnt being overridden differently

Author: namco-4#8876
Content: the actual registering takes place via RegisterRecipie();

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: but doesnt it need to generate the cache with all of the mods loaded?

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: and if the first mod regenerates the cache

Author: namco-4#8876
Content: it does, but that comes last, no matter what

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: then the other mods recipes wont be regenerated

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: ah okay

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: if youre sure 😃

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: anyways

Author: koizumisakiko
Content: im gonna rebuild my gunrack script and hopefully get the persiostence working for the attachments

Content: but items that have a inventorySlot[] array-entry are fine

Content: That would be dumb as hell, but it fits the data so far

Author: djctavia
Content:
Well the basic RPC sender is:
```
GetRPCManager().SendRPC( "RPCTestMod", "TestRPCFunction", new Param1< string >( "Hello, World!" ) );  
```
Basicly client send 1 RPC to Server, and Server send RPC to ALL clients on game
